hero-text.a: The 26th edition of JEEC is approaching and we want you to join us at

landing-section.contacts-text: For further information, feel free to contact us at

about-section.title: ABOUT US
about-section.text: The JEEC is an event organized by students, for students, from various courses at Instituto Superior Técnico, with a primary focus on Electrical and Computer Engineering. Our main objective is to fill the gap between the academic and business worlds, offering a range of activities to the entire community free of charge.

why-participate-section.title: WHY PARTICIPATE IN JEEC 26?
why-participate-section.text: Students participate in our event to connect with leading companies in the technology field and showcase their abilities to potential employers.

cards.c: Event organized by students for students
cards.f: Promote summer internships and job opportunities

job-fair.title: Job Fair
job-fair.text: Includes a stand in the main event area, providing direct contact between companies and students.

cv-platform.title: CV Platform
cv-platform.text: Exclusive access to CVs submitted by students during the week of the event.

eletrolink.title: EletroLink
eletrolink.text: Reserved space for conducting interviews or discussions with interested students, allowing you to manage your time during the allocated slot.

15-15.title: 15/15 Sessions
15-15.text: A 30-minute informational and knowledge-sharing session where companies have the opportunity to present a project or technology.

inside-talks.title: Inside Talks
inside-talks.text: Companies can bring an engineering professional to share their role, challenges, and ongoing projects with participants. Multiple companies will be present, and participants will rotate through roundtable discussions.

workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.text: A 1-hour session with up to 30 participants, focused on presenting a practical topic related to the company's field. We encourage the use of interactive strategies, such as case studies or the use of physical or software tools.

partnership-levels.title: ADVERTISING TIERS
partnership-levels.text: Participating in our event ensures your company's visibility across different tiers, depending on the number of activities you engage in. The official JEEC website and social media channels are regularly updated with information about the event, with a particular emphasis on the weeks leading up to it. Additionally, the event will be promoted to all students at Instituto Superior Técnico through the institution's official website and communication channels.

benefits.a: Exclusive video showcased at the event

partnership-levels.condition: *Subject to confirmation of participation and submission of the logo by March 31st

condition-list.title: Activity Scheduling:
condition-list.text: activity days and times are reserved on a first-come, first-served basis upon confirmation of participation;

condition-list.title: CV Platform and EletroLink:
condition-list.text: participation in these activities requires participation in at least one other activity;

condition-list.title: Parking:
condition-list.text: parking is available near the event venue for one vehicle per company;

condition-list.title: Lunch:
condition-list.text: complimentary lunch provided to all companies participating in the job fair, for up to 3 representatives;

condition-list.title: Coffee Break:
condition-list.text: access to all coffee breaks during the days of your participation in the event;

condition-list.title: Wi-fi:
condition-list.text: access to Wi-Fi throughout the event days;

condition-list.title: WebApp:
condition-list.text: access to our WebApp during the event, allowing you to award points to students and easily access information related to your participation.

a.question: What are the costs for participating?

text.a: Please schedule a meeting with us by sending an email to
text.b: , and we will provide you with detailed pricing information.

b.question: Do only Electrical Engineering students participate in the event?

text.b: Although the main focus of the event is indeed companies that are of interest to students of Electrical and Computer Engineering, our event ends up attracting students from other areas with a strong technological component, due to the broad scope of the course's fields of study.

c.question: What is the Técnico Innovation Center?
c.text: The Técnico Innovation Center (TIC) is one of the largest study spaces in the country and a hub of innovation. It features collaborative work areas, an exhibition zone, and a multipurpose area capable of hosting events with over 300 attendees, including its own dining space. The center is located at the former Arco do Cego train station in Lisbon, where this event will take place.

d.question: How many people can we bring?
d.text: Each company can have up to 3 representatives present at their stand. If needed, a rotational system can be used for additional staff; however, meals are only guaranteed for 3 people. Please send us the names of all representatives who will be attending the event.

e.question: What are the Job Fair hours?
e.text: The specific hours will be communicated closer to the event. Stay tuned for updates.

f.question: What materials are provided for the Job Fair?
f.text: Detailed information about the materials provided will be shared with participating companies before the event.

g.question: What space is available at the Job Fair?
g.text: Each participating company will be allocated a designated space. Further details on the exact dimensions and layout will be provided upon confirmation.

text.a: For invoicing purposes, JEEC's fiscal entity is the NEEC. The necessary details are as follows:

list.value: Nucleo de Estudantes de Electrotecnia e Computadores do Instituto Superior Tecnico
Instituto Superior Técnico (Campus Alameda) - Avenida Rovisco Pais 1, Pavilhão de Electricidade, Piso 4, Sala 4i.13, 1049-001 Lisboa, Portugal

text.b: As per Article 9 of the CIVA, NEEC is exempt from VAT. For more information on the billing process, please contact
